questions.question: Who wrote the poem The Bees?
questions.answer: William Shakespeare

questions.question: What do honey bees teach human beings?
questions.answer: The art of order

questions.question: Who is the ruler of the beehive?
questions.answer: Emperor bee

questions.question: Which bees are compared to magistrates?
questions.answer: Home-working bees

questions.question: Which bees venture trade abroad?
questions.answer: Merchant bees

questions.question: Which bees are armed with stings?
questions.answer: Soldier bees

questions.question: What do bees collect from summer’s velvet buds?
questions.answer: Nectar

questions.question: Where do bees bring their loot?
questions.answer: To the tent royal

questions.question: Who supervises the hive activities?
questions.answer: Emperor bee

questions.question: What happens to the lazy drone?
questions.answer: Punished

questions.question: What do honey bees teach us according to the poem?
questions.answer: They teach us discipline, cooperation, and order in society.

questions.question: Why are bees compared to human society?
questions.answer: Because they live an organised life with specific duties.

questions.question: Who sits in the tent royal?
questions.answer: The emperor bee sits in the tent royal.

questions.question: What does the emperor bee do?
questions.answer: He supervises and surveys all activities of the hive.

questions.question: What do roofs of gold refer to?
questions.answer: They refer to the honeycombs made of wax.

questions.question: Which bees are called masons?
questions.answer: Bees that build honeycombs are called masons.

questions.question: What work do civil citizen bees do?
questions.answer: They knead and prepare honey.

questions.question: Who are porter bees?
questions.answer: They carry heavy loads of nectar into the hive.

questions.question: Why is the drone punished?
questions.answer: Because it does no useful work.

questions.question: What message does the poem convey?
questions.answer: An organised and hardworking society prospers.
